title: What is the most recognized song lyric? - Quora

response.answer_text: It depends on your taste of music. i personally like every genre so once I know the song it could be only one word and I could realize it. But the most recognized song lyric to me are: “I’m not Okay”- “I’m not okay” by MyChemical Romance “This wallpaper glistens You’ll never see what goes down in the kitchen”- “Dollhouse” by Melanie Martinez “No body looks up anymore cause you might get a rain drop in you eye and heaven forbid they see you cry”- “March to the sea” by Twenty One Pilots “She’s a butcher with a smile cut me further than I’ve ever been”- “Tear in my heart” by Twenty One Pilots “Sipping on straight chlorine, let the vibes slide over me, this beat is a chemical, beat is a chemical”- “chlorine” by Twenty One Pilots “There’s vomit on his sweater already, Mom’s spaghetti” -”lose yourself” by Eminem “My milkshake brings all the boys to the yard” -”Milkshake” by Kelis “I said excuse me you’re a hell of a guy”- “Super Bass” by Nicki Minaj “Hey now you’re an all star”- “All star” by smash mouth “Don’t stop believing”- journey “I will survive”- Gloria Gaynor “All the single ladies”- beyonce “Haven’t you people ever heard of closing the godamn door”- Panic! at the Disco “RAH RAH AH AH AH! ROM MAH RO MAH MAH!”- Lady gaga “Don’t waste your time on me I’m already a voice inside my head” -”I miss you” by Blink 182. That’s all the songs I can think of the top of my head but those are obvious song lyrics to me, If you know them.

These answers are ridiculous. Hint: if you have to name the song or the artist after the lyric, then you are conceding that it won't be recognized. If the "most recognized lyric" is not instantly recognizable, then it is not the most recognized lyric. Yesterday, my friend from way down in Louisiana close to New Orleans just called to say she loved me, and you know that can't be bad. Chances are, if reading a lyric makes a song pop into the head of half the people reading this, it is pretty recognizable. Even though I just implanted 5 earworms, none of those familiar lyrics are as well recognized as "Happy Birthday to you" or "We wish you a Merry Christmas".
